intro: Langsdorfia, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in a fine, velvety texture. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Langsdorfia is native to regions of the Americas and is often found in wetlands and disturbed soils. It is sometimes considered an invasive species in certain areas due to its rapid growth and ability to spread easily.
